Community Hub
Meltdown
Meltdown is a tactical arcade shooter featuring both singleplayer and intense online multiplayer. Become the most skilled soldier, choose your weapons, get the best upgrades, buckle up and start your mission. Be careful, each enemy has it’s own combat style, special AI and gear. Adapt to them to survive!
User reviews: Very Positive (598 reviews) - 87% of the 598 user reviews for this game are positive.
Release Date: Jun 5, 2014

About This Game

Meltdown is a tactical arcade shooter featuring both singleplayer and intense online multiplayer.

Set against a captivating sci-fi backdrop, the action game invites players to follow its main character, Zed, as he tries to shoot his way out of the remote space station that he has been trapped on as a result of a system malfunction.

During the course of the adventure, players can collect loot and level-up their character as they make their way through randomly generated levels. They can choose to play single player or co-op multiplayer, while experiencing an engaging gameplay, matching their gaming skills and style.

Clear all the missions and run the prestige mode !

Key Features:

  • Online Cross-Platform Co-Op & PvP Up to 4 Players
  • Local Co-Op Up to 4 Players
  • 30 Random Generated Levels
  • 3 Specializations (Specialist/Soldier/Medic)
  • 3 Big Boss Battles
  • Wave-Attack arena challenges
  • VR Mode
READ MORE

10 of 12 people (83%) found this review helpful
Chef Lindsay
44 products in account
2 reviews
Recommended
28.4 hrs on record
Posted: July 14
This game is reminicent of old fashioned quarter dropping arcade days spent at the mall killing a saturday during the summer. It is as addictive as it is pure fun. The graphics are colorful and the interface is non-obtrusive. Truly a hidden gem among the thousands of cooperative games on steam. This one is a shining example of simple and well executed game design.
The added bonus of challenging gameplay combined with just the right amount of shoot and loot. You will laugh everytime you level up, which is every 3 minutes. Well worth my time, and I have a young son to take care of. My time is limited and this game is easy to drop in and drop out.
Coming from an indie developer, this game is top notch. There are only a few minor bugs and no lobby system but I have enjoyed every minute played.
10/10
Oh yeah don't forget...the slow motion never gets old. Grab this game. Well worth it and usually there is a coupon on coupon dumpster if you're thrifty.
I'd buy that for a dollar. ;)
Bonuses:
Local and online co-op
Easy to pick up
Fun as all get out
Will remind you why you game in the first place
A great game that looks good and keeps you hooked

Ruff Rogers
1,353 products in account
12 reviews
Recommended
27.0 hrs on record
Posted: June 7
Meltdown is a sort of dual stick shoot 'em up in space. Actually it's set on a space station that seems to have gone mad and is intent on ending your life by sending all of it's robots after you. Using an isometric perspective the game seems to give a nod to gaming of yesteryear.

You will have to fight wave after wave of them, but you can bring some friends along with you as the game has a neat multiplayer mode. You can play online of locally if you prefer, but the more players you have the tougher the enemies become. There are plenty of objects to hide behind making the game a sort of cover based shooter. Every few levels feature a boss which makes for some great multiplayer action, but can seem a little daunting when you're on your own.

If there's one small complaint it is that most of it looks the same, but this doesn't really matter when you're busy blasting the hell out of those metal nut cases.

SpaceCouncil
1,088 products in account
63 reviews
Recommended
6.1 hrs on record
Posted: September 24
I picked this up on a whim during a sale thinking it'd be a fun distraction for my fingers whilst I listen to podcasts. It did not disappoint.

Its essentially a twin stick shooter. With an extremely addictive gameplay loop. Unfortunately the reasons it becomes addictive is that its set up almost exactly like a free to play game. The good aspect of this once you buy it, no more actual money is needed to play. There are multiple resources in order to level your character, weapons and gear up.

There are coins, chips and skill points as well as other requirements to unlock new gear which will allow for different styles of play. However mostly its a mixture of fast moving character builds or tank builds or some concoction of assorted gear designed to min/max coin drops or XP gain. There is even some gear that requires the renowned 'prestige' mode to unlock. Another aspect of the free to play model breaking through is that enemies occasionally drop mystery boxes which are opened individually at the end of a mission and yes, some of them are empty.

Another aspect I rather enjoy is that there is drop in drop out co-op up to 4 players and the more players there are an instance or mission, stronger and more enemies are spawned with more XP to be gained for all. It borrows from Diablo in the way the loot on screen is only grabbable by yourself. So there is no fighting over coin and chip drops.

If your looking for something mildly mindless but enjoyable and like games 'where the numbers go up' this is sure to deliver.

Jonok
90 products in account
11 reviews
Not Recommended
25.4 hrs on record
Posted: September 26
This game looking good at the beginning, the gameplay is solid, graphic looks good and music is pretty but when you want to get into there are some issues make me to not recommend this game:
- Level are too similar, they change a little whit some new area but they all feel the same.
- Some enemy have a pretty weak AI, they shooting you outrange or approaching blindly and die.
- When you reach the level cap you have to activate the "prestige mode" resetting your progresses for power ups, this seems an uninspired way to give more longevity to the game and waste your time.
- there's not even a real ending, neither a "you win" screen just complete the last mission (or the all same generate level with a element repeated in other levels) and done.

this seems a bad case of early access, should give more but in the end the development just release without even complete all idea for the game.

SixHealthOfFury
1,720 products in account
12 reviews
Not Recommended
6.4 hrs on record
Posted: September 21
I like this game a lot. I'm giving it a negative review because a patch they released for Occulus Rift support prevents any XP user from playing. They haven't fixed it for over 3 months. The game advertises as being sold to run on XP. They are lying to customers and several buyers before the refund policy have been shafted because of this. When it is fixed, I will recommend this game.

Do not bother telling me to update my OS. This is strictly reading the requirements listed in the store page. Work as advertise or modify the listing so people aren't given false hope they can multiplayer with a friend.

Pros: Controls are well done as a twin stick run and gun style game. None of the buttons are in weird places of the keyboard and conforms to first person shooter standards.

Guns fire with a satisfying feel from the sound of the shotgun, to the recoil from holding down the machinegun.

Equipment provides enough variables to promote tactics, such as using equipment that boosts shotgun damage or even having nothing equipped to move faster if that is something you want.

Con: The delay of switching from melee back to gun leaves you too vulnerable to want to use in later levels. It became a gimmick that looks cool, but will end up killing you easily.

There is an end game where you can no longer level up and get new things to make life easier playing this. Once you complete the campaign, you will more than likely stop playing because you will have beaten all the content there is to have.

The latter half of the game will be grinding for chips to upgrade gear.
